article.title: 1000 AU Exterior Arcs Connected to the Protoplanetary Disk around HL Tau

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the approximate size of the central compact component traced by both the C18O and 13CO emission in HL Tau?
choices: 20 AU
100 AU
280 AU

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE about the extended structures seen in the 13CO emission?
choices: They are aligned with the directions of the molecular outflows.
They are perpendicular to the directions of the molecular outflows.
They exhibit a velocity gradient in the opposite direction to the molecular outflows.
They are only visible in the redshifted velocity channels.

multiple_choice_question.text: What observational signature suggests that the central compact component is a protoplanetary disk?
choices: The presence of extended structures.
The alignment of the component with known outflows.
The velocity gradient along its major axis, consistent with Keplerian rotation.
The difference in morphology between the C18O and 13CO emission.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the estimated spatial resolution of the ALMA observations used to create this figure?
What does the C18O emission primarily trace in HL Tau?
choices: A compact central component.
Extended arc structures.
A bipolar molecular outflow.
A large-scale expanding shell.

multiple_choice_question.text: How does the size of the blue- and redshifted C18O components change with increasing velocity?
choices: The size remains constant.
The size decreases with increasing velocity.
The size increases with increasing velocity.
The size changes randomly with velocity.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the position angle (PA) of the axis passing through the peak positions of the high-velocity blue- and redshifted C18O components?
Along which axis are the medium-low and low-velocity C18O components elongated?
choices: The disk\'s minor axis.
The disk\'s major axis.
The direction of the molecular outflows.
The direction perpendicular to the molecular outflows.
